result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry E Thomas

records.addlTxt:
10:44 AM State Public Defender's Office Law Intern Patrick Sicula for Attorney Anna Kees for the Defense.  Defendant Larry E Thomas in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another status date.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Request to adjourn next hearing filed by Atty Kees.  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 7/19/22 - Hearing has to be rescheduled due to a trial.** Request granted.

10:22 AM  Attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern in court.   Defendant Larry E Thomas did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is unsure where their client is today. 
State requests capias to issue, bail revoke and forfeit. 
Court issues capias, revoke and forfeit bail. 

MATTER RECALLED AT 10:  am  Same appearances, however the defendant now appears in person. 
Court vacates prior order of capias. 
Defense wishes to waiver preliminary hearing. 
Court conducts colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant waives preliminary hearing.
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts receipt of the information, waives reading. 
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Anna Kees as counsel of record for the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:52 PM Defendant Larry E Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
